Author: djc_tech

Comment: Depends on how things go. There's no doubt in my mind that the administration wants China to come to the table and negotiate. Status quo remains, we get a better trade agreement, and maybe we can actually hold China to their promises unlike the past. However, if China does not come to the table, the idea is to bring jobs back to the US. This is less ideal short term for multiple reasons. The worst part would be that you would see many items increase in price dramatically. Even long term, we may not equalize to what we were. The administration definitely doesn't want to go this route as they may lose the faith of the American public and we could lose the house/senate in the upcoming elections. Then in 2028, we go back to the status quo where China gets away with murder.
